1438.html:
Seer fish:
Seer fish (vanjiram) is one of the mostly known favourite fish around every seafood lovers. Most special about this fish is its taste and bone less. Recipes like fish fry, fish fingers are very famous and for fish biryani this is the most suitable fish.

Black pomfret:
Black pomfret (karuppu vavval) is the commercial fish among local market. Most of the hotels chooses this fish because of the various cooking choices. The taste of the vavval fry, vavval grill are mind blowing, this fish contains high amount of omega 3 and low in fat.

Trevelly:
Trevelly are called as paarai in Tamil. There are about 14 varieties of paarai are available in various part of the shore and markets. Golden trevally and Malabar trevally are the varieties delivered from Eseafood.in because of the taste and natural quality of the fish.

Seabass:
Seabass (koduva) is the favourite fish for most of the seafood lovers. There are lot of recipes prepared from this fish. Cutting and removing the gilles and other waste from Fish reduces about 30% of the fish weight. In chettinadu and andhra kitchen koduva fish fry, curry and kolambu using its head and tail are very famous.

Shark:
Shark (sura) fish are mostly famous to prepare the side dish. If its shark fish it is well known for puttu which tastes awesome. Pal sura is one of the healthy and have some medical terms for motherhood. Some part of the shark fish are used for some medicine  purpose.

Tuna:
Tuna (soorai) the no1 fish and food variety in protein content. Tuna has rich omega 3, this fish smell very low. Eating thrice in a week is advisable and benefit for health. Most of the bodybuilders choose tuna as a main food in their diet, tuna fish helps to grow your muscles more and faster. You never forget the taste of this fish if you eat it once.

Baracudda:
Baracudda is also known as sheela meen in some part of south india. It has rich nutrition values. Fish is very easy to cut and clean, cubical shaped slices are very easy to handle and prepare fry and curry. Sheela fish tastes great with Indian masala, kids loves its taste.

Red snapper (small):
Red snapper called as Sankara meen, a largely consumed fish variety In south India. Medium size sankara fish will be fried mostly because of its taste, and also tastes better with sambar. This fish recipes are also prepared as snacks varieties.

Red snapper (large):
A large sized red snappers are called as Kendal and sevappu meen in shores, but in fish market it called as Sankara. This large sized red snapper is used to prepare continental dishes, grill, and other high class dishes n hotel, it is rarely consumed in our kitchen because of it's availability. This fish tastes awesome, people who knows about this fish taste will never stop buying it again.

Lady fish:
Lady fish is called as white kelangan a most favourite for kids.
Every mother cook this lady fish for their little kids because of lean size of the fish which is easy to eat. This fish is prepared as fish fry, fish chips and eat at snacks time with sauce. Since it is a seasonal fish gtting this fish as fresh is very rare.

Indian mackrel:
Indian mackrel is called as aylai and kanangaluthi. Aylai fish is most favourite for all seafood lovers because of its taste and health benefits. This has high omega 3 and protein packed fish. This fish cooked as fry, curry, kolambu and also cooked as grill. People are warned not to preserve this fish and eat, consuming fresh is advisable.

Anchovies:
Anchovies is called as nethili and netholi. This fish is known by almost every one because of its size this looks small and silver shined. This is very favourite in restaurants, hotels, small size food shops, etc. Kids to grown, nethili fry loved by every one.. Other main benefit is nethili fish is cheaper than other fish.

Sardines:
Sardines are called as maththi and  kavala meen. This is a fish which has the same amount of health and taste benefits like ayalai fish. Almost all health benefits are included in this fish naturally, cutting and cleaning this fish is bit challenge. Recipes like varutha meen, curry, kolambu are the favourites, fish bone are easy to separate and eat. Maththi meen tastes awesome for kids.

Prawns:
More varieties of recipes can be done from this white prawn/shrimp. This this not only best for its taste, it also has a huge weight loss benefits and true beauty nutrition food. Cooking prawn too much is not advisable, if it does you can't consume its complete nutrition benefits.

Sea spotted crab
Crabs are known as nandu, it's hard shell is well known for its look. Crab is a great source of vitamin B12 also low in fat. Sea crab has huge  varieties of recipes like nandu curry, nandu thokku. Nandu soup, nandu kolambu, crab meat alone used for many dishes. Chettinadu type of cooking and andhra type of cooking really gives mouth watering taste.

1450.html:
Saravanan, name the Terms & Conditions as Delivery terms


ACCEPTANCE OF DELIVERY TERMS

Thank you for using eseafoods. These Terms of Service (Delivery terms) are intended to make you aware of do’s and don’ts of our service and responsibilities with respect to your access use of the Ennore’s Seafood website at www.eseafoods.in (the “Online Fish Market”).

 

These Delivery Terms are effective for all existing and future eseafoods users who order with us through online and through phone call.

 

INTRODUCTION

We are Ennore’s Seafood, a fresh fish home delivery service from shore to door. A brand deals with all kind of sea fishes, prawns, crab, squid, oyster, lobster and dry fish.

 

1. Online Agreement

User: User or "You" or "Your" refers to you, as a user of the Services. A user is someone who accesses or uses the Services for the purpose of interest, sharing, displaying, ordering, publishing, transacting, or uploading information or views or pictures and includes other persons jointly participating in using the Services including without limitation a user having access to ‘service page’ to manage product listings or otherwise. Product we displayed in website can be accessed through website and restricted to copy and use it somewhere in online. Managing users delivery details and other service details with eseafoods are completely secured from other users and other network and hackers.

 

2. Service Guarantee

Product management team from Ennore’s Seafood manages all aspects of quality of the displayed products and no other contract or outsourced team is responsible for this. Product listed online are subject to availability, any out of season product which is in display will not be access for ordering purpose. Standard process is followed on handling the product from cleaning to packing.

 

3. Ordering

All our seasonal fish varieties are accessed for ordering online through our own online software (www.eseafoods.in), order can also made via phone call at given phone number.


All your orders should be made one day before, our online software built in such a way so carefully choose the delivery time with is displayed in “fish basket”.


Minimum order Guarantee

We have minimum order guarantee both in quantity and cost value. These both terms are applicable for every order.


. Minimum quantity should be above 1kg for your first order, your second  

  order can go below 1 kg, our software allows you to order in this terms. 


. Minimum cost value should be above Rs. 299/-, if your order is below the

  minimum price value software don't allows you to complete the order.

 

Any order that you place with us is subject to product availability, delivery capacity and acceptance by us. When you place your order online, we will send you an email to confirm that we have received it. This email confirmation will be produced automatically so that you have confirmation of your order details.


You must inform us immediately if any details are incorrect. The fact that you receive an automatic confirmation does not necessarily mean that we filled and approved your order. Once we have sent the confirmation email we will check availability of the product in season once again and delivery capacity.

If any issue on delivering the product like out of season, no fish catching due to climate any availability issue our concern executive will be contact you for an alternatives, its your wish to go for alternative or cancelling. Order after verifying with you will be sent as SMS for conformation from eseafoods.

 

Your details like name, phone number, email id, delivery address, land mark should be very clear for timely delivery, any of this details are not clear or wrong, our executives will try contact you to verify it, if still there’s a problem in identifying to exact delivery details the order placed will be cancelled and information will be send to the given mobile number and email address.

 

4. Pricing

Price displayed for the product is depends on market, which will be changed in daily basis only if market changes. We don’t have any handling charges, packing charges and delivery charges. We too don’t have any service tax charges and VAT charges.

 

5. Cleaning Process

We cut and clean the fishes on your request, which is chargeable. You can also buy the fish with out this cleaning process that will be delivered as a whole fish. We have a standard process for cleaning the fresh seafood.

 

Whole fish: This choice of fish varieties will not be cut or cleaned this will be weighed on your quantity and packed as it is.

 

Whole fish – cleaned: On your request of cleaning the whole fish we take this in to our process.

Step1: We weigh the fish quantity and fix it to your specification of quantity.

Step2: We trim the skin and gills

Step3: We cut the fish at your choice of cooking you request

Step4: We clean the fish once in water, which contains salt and little amount of turmeric to remove high amount of odor from the fish and make it Ready to Cook. Other step of cleaning you can do it on your choice once the product is delivered

 

Steaks & Fillet: This choice of fish varieties will also clean in the same process on your request.

 

Prawn de-shell: Prawn varieties will be de-shelled on your request which is chargeable as mentioned in website. All size of prawns will be take in to this de-shell process and will be cleaned in normal fresh water without salt and turmeric.

 

Prawn de-vein: Prawn varieties will be de-veined on your request which is chargeable as mentioned in website. Small size and medium size prawn will not be de-veined due to its size. Large, X-large, XX-large prawns will be take in to this de-vein process and will be cleaned in normal fresh water without salt and turmeric.

 

Crab de-shell: Crab varieties will be de-shelled on your request which is chargeable as mentioned in website. All size of crab will be take in to this de-shell process and will be cleaned in normal fresh water without salt and turmeric with additional charges.

 

6. Concept packing

Once all the process is done as per the specification of your order, it get packed in “Eco friendly” packing and tagged with delivery information and takes to deliver.

 

7. Delivery

All orders are delivered by a reputable delivery service. We will make every effort to deliver within the time stated, however in case of time delay in delivery due to rain or natural calamity we will mentioned it earlier to your given mobile number.

 

If you fail to accept delivery at the time when person is ready for delivery, or we are unable to deliver at the nominated time due to your failure to provide appropriate instructions, or authorizations, then such goods shall be deemed to have been delivered to you and all risk and responsibility in relation to such goods shall pass to you. Any storage, insurance and other costs, which we incur as a result of the inability to deliver, shall be your responsibility and you shall indemnify us in full for such cost.

 

8. Cancellation

We may cancel a order if the product is not available for any reason. We will notify you the same and request for any alternatives or cancellation. This information will be passed to you when we procure the product at early morning between 5 am – 7 am. If the cancellation was made at that time and once the accepted your cancellation, we will refund or re-credit your debit or credit card with the full amount within 14 days.

 

8. Return policy

All our orders while delivered are requested to recheck and pay, incase of any issue in quality of the product we request you to contact with our customer service person through the given centralized number and the order can be returned for no cost if it is COD terms of payment. If the payment is paid already through online through visa/master service we will refund or re-credit your debit or credit card with the full amount within 14 days.


If we are the responsible person on delivers a wrong item, you have the right to reject the delivery of the wrong item and you shall be fully refunded for the missing item. If we can only do a partial delivery (a few items might be not available), its staff should inform you or propose a replacement for missing items. You have the right to refuse a partial order before delivery and get a refund. We are responsible for all wrong or partial delivery.

 


 




Thanks & best wishes
mp

1555.html:
21 recommendations for our 21st edition.

Shopify for Designers #021

It’s our coming of age edition.

It feels like only yesterday that we started out on our quest to launch a design-focused newsletter for our Partners, and here we are turning 21. Sadly there’s no party or firework displays to report — instead we thought we’d try something completely different. If you like it, maybe we’ll carry on; if not, we’ll just call it the “summer reading edition” and get back to normal in September.

So without further ado, here are 21 links for your late summer reading. All these links are culled from my Pocket feed — if you are in need of a “read later” service, I definitely recommend it.

Staying current
Keeping on top of new trends, apps, tools, and techniques can be very time consuming. I am a big fan of letting others do the work for me which is why I spend my time hunting out great curators instead of reading great articles. Here are three resources I look at daily:

  • Designer News: Recently taken over by Andrew Wilkinson and with big plans for the future, Designer News is a great place to keep up to date.
  • Panda: An online dashboard for designers, developers, and entrepreneurs that aggregates content from Hacker News, Product Hunt, and Dribbble. A digest email is also available.
  • Web Designer News: Provides web designers and developers with a single source to discover the latest stories on the web.

Creativity
I’ve always been fascinated by companies, their culture, their working practices, and the people behind the brands. I find I get a lot of inspiration looking at other creative industries — advertising in particular. Here are three books that I have found very insightful:

  • Damn Good Advice (For People With Talent!): George Lois has been described as America's 'Master Communicator.' This book is an easy to read, no-holds-barred, “compendium of lessons for a life lived to the fullest, written for anyone looking to make a creative difference.”
  • Hegarty on Creativity — There Are No Rules: I bought this on the back of an interview on Monocle 24 with the author. This pocket-sized book contains great advice on how to improve, sustain, and nurture creativity.
  • Creative Mischief: Another small book that packs a punch. David Trott’s musings will help your thinking about any creative process, regardless of your industry.

Email
For some time I have been contemplating creating a t-shirt with the slogan “email is a job” — maybe I should KickStarter it? As much as we love to hate email, it remains a hugely important tool. It’s also a great way to keep in touch with clients. I seemingly read and bookmark a lot on email — here are three that got my attention:

  • Revue: An online tool (with free plan) that allows you to curate your own email digest. A professional and easy way to keep your subscribers in the loop.
  • 15 Tips for Welcome Email: Sometimes we need to be reminded of the obvious. This article just does that and highlights creative ways people are using automated email communications — many of which are from respected ecommerce brands.
  • Hack Your Productivity With These 9 Gmail Tips: I recently ditched my life-long search for the perfect Mac email client and went back to Gmail in the browser. This article shows nine ways you can really exploit Gmail in your workflow.

Work from anywhere
As a remote worker, I find myself reading many articles on the topic. From being a digital nomad to tools that help you feel more “in the loop,” it’s a fascinating topic. Here are three posts that resonated with me:

  • One Way Ticket Preview: A ten-minute preview of a soon-to-be-released documentary about those who have embraced the digital nomad lifestyle.
  • Ultimate Guide to Being a Lady Nomad: As the author says, some of the tips apply specifically to women, but many are just plain useful for anyone who likes to work and travel.
  • Who Needs an Office?: Neil Patel outlines six reasons why business owners should consider going 100% remote.

Business
At Shopify, we love hearing how our Partners are growing their ecommerce-focused web businesses. We shared many of their secrets in our Grow book and the recent Skillshare course we launched. Here are three business articles that you might find useful:

  • Want to Master Social Media? 9 Tips from the Pros: I’ve been enjoying this blog for a few weeks now. This article gives you tangible actions to find your voice on social platforms.
  • The 4-1-1 Rule for Lead Nurturing: A very businessy title but interesting take on how to approach tweeting when you are ultimately hoping to attract clients or sales.
  • Marketing Stack: A site full of focused links covering all aspects of online and digital marketing.

The want list
Occasionally it’s nice to splash out on a new toy, something for the desk, or a new piece of technology. Alternatively, treat this as a list for that hard-to-buy-for techy designer in your life:

  • Designer Playing Cards: Each of the 52 playing cards contains a useful piece of information about graphic design, including typography, colour theory, design techniques, history, and more.
  • The Stood: I have one of these and am very impressed. Put simply, it’s a really easy-to-assemble laptop stand for use on the road. Money well spent.
  • Tortuga Backpack: I have to stop myself from buying more backpacks. I see a new one I like and almost always hit the BUY NOW button. This is now top of my list — oh, and they are on Shopify!

And finally...
Whenever you compile a post like this, there are always a few links that don’t neatly align. Here are three that are included “just because”:

  • Bartender: A useful tool for managing your Mac toolbar. If yours is anything like mine, there’s little room for any more apps — especially when not attached to my monitor.
  • Mahabis Slipper: I live in the UK, and slippers are important. Imagine my delight when I found these! The kicker is the detachable sole — how clever. These would not be out of place in your design studio.
  • ZNAPS: A specially designed, magnetic connection adapter for your mobile devices. This KickStarter project has raised over $2.8M CAD — that’s just a little bit over their $120K goal! WOW.

Thanks for reading! And in the spirit of sharing, please feel free to drop me your recent reads via our Twitter account.

See you in September,
Keir

P.S: Don't forget to enter the Shopify Ecommerce Design Awards before the contest closes on August 31st. 

Unsubscribe  |  View this email on the web  |  www.shopify.com/partners

Shopify  |  150 Elgin Street, Ottawa ON, K2P 1L4

1569.html:
Saravanan, please update this weighing policy as 5th point


5. Weighing policy

All our weighed fish are exactly done using the certified standard weighing machine. Weighing fish varieties are completely genuine; none of the fish varieties will be weighed lesser than the expected quantity given in the order.

 

Whole fish: These types of fish varieties will be weighed before trim, cut and clean. None of the fish varieties will be weighed below the quantity ordered. After the weighing process the fish will be trimmed, cut and cleaned, once this process is done the weight of the fish will be reduces because of removing gills, stomach part, and other unwanted parts from the fish you order. The reduce of the fish weight after cleaning process varies from different fish varieties for eg: seer fish is the one which has less bone, sea bass fish has large head and thicker bone, prawn head and its shell has the equal weight of the flesh.

 

Steaks: These types fish varieties will be weighed after trim, cut process then it takes to cleaning.

 

Fillets: These types fish varieties will be weighed after trim, cut process without bone and takes to cleaning

 

De-shell: De-shelled are done for prawn and crab varieties. Prawns are weighed before de-shell process

And de-shelled it on order request. This process removes the shell and head part of the prawn which comes about 40% to 45% from the total weight percentage.

 

De-vein: De-vein are done for large size prawn varieties. Prawns are weighed before de-shell and

de-vein process And de-shelled and de0-veined it on order request. This process removes the shell and head part of the prawn and de-vein which comes about 45% to 50% from the total weight percentage.





Thanks & best wishes
